revised_title: Samuel Francis Boys: A Life in Theoretical Chemistry
tldr: Samuel Francis Boys was a prominent theoretical chemist and mathematician who made significant contributions to the fields of quantum chemistry and optical rotatory power. Born in Pudsey, Yorkshire, Boys studied at the University of Cambridge and Imperial College London, where he conducted research in theoretical chemistry. He held various positions at universities and research institutions, including the Armaments Research Department during World War II. Boys was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1972 and passed away later that year. His life and work are remembered for his dedication to research and his unique combination of expertise in chemistry and mathematics.
